intro: Calliandra eriophylla, commonly known as the silky calliandra, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its distinctive, feathery, pink to red flower clusters that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value and ability to fix nitrogen, it is often used in landscaping and soil improvement.
